short_summary: Procurement of office furniture under a supply arrangement for the Canada Border Service Agency (CBSA) in Montreal
description: The Government of Canada, through Public Service and Procurement Canada (PSPC), is seeking proposals from qualified suppliers for the acquisition of office seating chairs, including delivery and installation. As detailed in Annex A.
full_summary:
Requirements for the Acquisition of Office Seating Chairs for the Canada Border Services Agency (CBSA)
=====================================================

The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) is pleased to issue a Request for Proposal (RFP) on behalf of the Canada Border Services Agency (CBSA) for the acquisition of office seating chairs to meet the requirements of SA E60PQ-120001.

**Key Details:**

* **Solicitation Number (numéroSollicitation)**: WS4201570378
* **Publication Date (datePublication)**: 2023-09-14
* **Tender Closing Date (appelOffresDateCloture)**: 2023-10-03, at 14:00:00 Eastern Daylight Time (EDT)
* **Location (emplacement)**: Montreal, Quebec, Canada

**Description of Requirements:**

The RFP aims to acquire office seating chairs, including delivery and installation, for the CBSA offices located in Montreal. The requirements are outlined in Annex A.

**Technical Specifications (Spécifications techniques):**

* Category: Office furniture (Mobilier de bureau)
* UNSPSC Code: 56101700
* CFTA Agreement: Canadian Free Trade Agreement (Accord de libre-échange canadien)

**Submission Instructions (instructions de soumission):**

* Bidders are required to submit their proposals electronically.
* Proposals must be received by the designated closing date and time.
* The contact person will be Julien, Lisa-Marie, who can be reached at lisa-marie.julien@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca.

**Note:**

This opportunity is subject to the Trade Agreement and/or Trade Agreement Clause(s) (Accord de libre-échange et/ou clause(s) d’accord de libre-échange) specified in the procurement notice.

Please ensure to review the procurement notice thoroughly and to submit your proposal by the closing date to avoid misunderstandings. Good luck!
